result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven J. Spencer

records.addlTxt: Final pre-trial on November 21, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Writ of Habeas Corpus

3:32 PM/ RM 203.  Defendant Steven J. Spencer appeared by video, in custody in Jackson Correctional Institution.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Court reviews case history. Hearing was supposed to be called on 10/10/22 at 3:00 PM, but there were technical issues and matter was rescheduled for today, 10/11/22. Prompt disposition was filed. by Def. Court notes arraignment previously held, Not Guilty plea entered. Court also notes appointment of counsel report. Def. continues to wish for an Atty and prompt disposition. State cannot make any contact or negotiations with Def. at this time due to Def. requesting counsel. Def. is aware of PD Office attempts to provide counsel for Def. Court finds constructive waiver to right to counsel based on Def. request for prompt disposition. Def. questions constructive waiver, Court responds. Def. requests Jury Trial, Court responds. Given constructive waiver, State will make and send Def. offer in a letter to Jackson Correctional Institution and will schedule matter for jury trial due to prompt disposition. Def. questions plea negotiation, Court denies. Final Pre-Trial scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 11:00 AM. Jury Trial 12 person scheduled for December 7, 2022 at 8:30 AM.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report

3:07 PM Defendant Steven J. Spencer appeared by phone, in custody from Jackson Correctional Inst.  Prosecuting attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for the State of Wisconsin, via zoom.  Def. did not receive copy of information. State notes Information mirrors criminal complaint. Court notes counsel report filed.  Def. is requesting prompt disposition. State notes continue to move forward without counsel. Court heard on law for prompt disposition. Court will continue to move forward without counsel.  Def. would like attorney to guide defendant.  Def. never waived right to counsel and enters Not Guilty plea.  Court receives Not Guilty plea. State would like to set for Jury Trial and heard on issues with counsel. CC wants this case schedule for him on Monday @ 1:30 and not a Status Cnf.  Def. heard on discovery.  Court notes.
Hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report

1:32 PM Defendant Steven J. Spencer appeared by video, in custody from Jackson Correctional Inst.  Attorney Kelly Hays in court for State of Wisconsin. Court notes prompt disposition filed and confusing on attorney status. Counsel report filed. Def. wants counsel to be appointed to def.  Def. wants waiver of preliminary hearing. Court goes over waiver of preliminary examination form. Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing.  Court accepts waiver and finds probable cause and binds over. Court will set for arraignment.  Information filed electronically however has not been sent to def.  DA cannot communicate to defendant as still wishes to have an attorney.
Arraignment scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report
Waiver of Prelim on September 6, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

3:11 PM Defendant Steven J. Spencer appeared by phone, in custody at Jackson Correctional Institution.  Attorney Kelly Hays in court for State of Wisconsin. Court reviews case history. Def. does wish to retain counsel and has reached out to the PD office. Def. has filed speedy disposition and wishes to waive initial and preliminary hearings and requests a demand for discovery. Def. does not wish to have counsel. State has received and has 120 days for prompt disposition. Def. waives right to counsel, but explains counsel needs to take waiver of Atty. Def. questions 120 days, Court explains. Def. has received a copy of the criminal complaint. Waiver of Atty. form needs to be completed, but Court will complete oral. Court explains and reviews statue. Court goes off record to review. Court goes back on record 3:21 PM. Court has had opportunity to review statue 971.11, prompt disposition. Trial shall be scheduled within 120 days. Def. would like to be set for a Preliminary Waiver. Def. to file written waiver of preliminary hearing. Def. does not wish to waive right to atty. Def. wants to do waiver without counsel. State will not be issuing a subpoena. Def. requests a signature bond. Court denies Def. request. Def. would like to appear via zoom for waiver of prelim hearing, Court agrees. 
Waiver of Prelim scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report

2:54 PM Defendant Steven J. Spencer appeared by video, in custody @ Jackson Correctional Inst. .  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin. All parties via zoom. Counsel report filed by P.D. Court reviews.  Def. will still wait for attorney.  Court finds good cause and heard on Nhia Lee Standards. Def. would like court appointed atty be appointed today. Court advise def. to put request in writing.  Def. request prompt disposition.  Court will not appoint court appointed atty today.  Def. heard on 6th amendment right.  CC advise def. to put request in writing.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report

Court calls @ 01:40 PM Defendant Steven J. Spencer in court, in custody.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Steven J. Spencer appeared by video means from Dodge Correctional Inst. All parties vai zoom.  Court reviews case. Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties. State advised court initial appearance has already been completed.  Def. wants to wait for counsel.  Def. wants to reduce bond.  State will consider to modify bond. Def. wants cash bond.  Court will not lower bond.  Court heard on time limits for p.h. and finds good cause to go past time limits.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

03:17 PM Defendant Steven J. Spencer in court, in custody, via zoom.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Steven J. Spencer appeared by video means.  Court reviews status of counsel report. Def. will continue to wait for counsel. CC makes record regarding preliminary examination and finds good cause to go past time limit. Bond continues.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report

03:49 PM Defendant Steven J. Spencer in court, in custody.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Steven J. Spencer appeared by video means. All parties via zoom.  Def. contacted P.D. and is eligible and will continue to wait.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Bail/Bond
no illegal use or possession of controlled substances and no contact with S.G.S.

01:28 PM Defendant Steven J. Spencer in court, in custody. Steven J. Spencer appeared by Zoom means. Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Zoom. All parties via Zoom. Def. has not received a copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty. The court reviews the complaint with the def. Attorney Gebert makes statement and recommendation of a $7,500 cash bond with condition of no illegal use or possession of controlled substances and no contact with S.G.S. Def. gives response to DA. The court makes ruling. Court orders a $7,500 cash bond with conditions of no illegal use or possession of controlled substances and no contact with S.G.S. An adjourned initial appearance is scheduled 4/25/22 at 1:30pm. Court is adjourned.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
